info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:52PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will continue to impact portions of northwestern Catawba, western Alexander, Caldwell and northeast Burke Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 150 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong storms from around Lenoir to near Hickory, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickory, Lenoir, Longview, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Gamewell, Bethlehem, Hudson, Icard and Cajah`s Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
